meanings.definition: In the direction from which the wind is blowing.
meanings.sent1: The leaves rustled windwards as the breeze picked up.
meanings.sent2: Sailors adjusted the sails to head windwards towards the shore.
meanings.sent3: The kite flew windwards, almost pulling the string from my hand.
meanings.sent4: Her hair streamed windwards, following the path of the gusty wind.
meanings.sent5: The flag fluttered windwards, signaling the change in weather.

meanings.sent1: The ship sailed windwards, battling against the strong gusts.
meanings.sent2: The birds flew windwards, seeking refuge from the storm.
meanings.sent3: The kite soared windwards, dancing in the turbulent air currents.
meanings.sent4: The trees leaned windwards, bending under the force of the wind.
meanings.sent5: The clouds moved windwards, painting the sky with shades of gray.
